alert.note: Alert for Dillon; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dillon and southeastern Marlboro Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 822 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brownsville, or 13 miles west of Dillon, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownsville, Oak Grove, Bingham and Minturn. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 182 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
